result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Jose Luis Montes Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Jose Luis Montes Lopez in court with attorney Christopher W. Duren.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Rights/Elements, Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Ct. 3, Ct. 4, and Ct. 5, Court withholds adjudication on Ct. 1, approves 24 month DPA, Judgment to be entered on Ct. 3, 4, and 5, Ct. 2 dismissed, read in,  Ct. 3, 4, and 5, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, Ct. 3, $543.00 costs, 20 days jail w/Huber stayed until 11/2/15 to complete AODA and any treatment recommendations, if completed the stay will not be lifted, if not completed defendant to report to the Jail on 11/2/15 at 7:00 P.M., AODA and comply, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobrietyCt. 4, $553.00 costs, AODA and comply, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety, Ct. 5, $543.00 costs, AODA and comply, domestic abuse counseling, maintain absolute sobriety,  1 day sentence credit

2:35 Defendant Jose Luis Montes Lopez in court with attorney Christopher W. Duren.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State would like motion denied.  Victim is not present.  Request was sent over a month ago.  Atty Duren gave argument.  Court acknowledged victims request was over a month ago, and she is not present in court today.  Defendant does have a plea/sentencing hearing today.  Court denied motion.  2:43

Defendant, Jose Luis Montes Lopez, appeared, in custody with Atty. Amanda Riek. Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Translator Evon Routson sworn in. $350 cash bond with felony conds. Maintain absolute sobriety. Not go premises where alcohol sold for on-site consumption, may be on premises of Monk's for employment purposes. No contact with B.B., her residence, her workplace. May return to residence one time with officer to get personal belongings. Third party contact with victim for child placement/visitation purposes only. Time limits waived.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Return date scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
